div.h3: Monitoring of Already Diagnosed Patient Workflow

img.alt: Monitoring of Already Diagnosed Patient Workflow diagram

div.p: If a patient who has a diagnosis of hypertension accesses this tool, this workflow will run.

First, the tool checks to see if the patient has a current blood pressure goal. If the patient does not, it sets a default goal of <140/90 mmHg and checks to see if the patient would like to adjust that goal. The tool will then check whether it can find a complete set of blood pressure readings. If it cannot, it will recommend taking additional blood pressure readings either at home or in a clinical setting.

If either all blood pressure readings or the set of blood pressures averages greater than 140/90 mmHg, the tool will recommend that the patient begin both pharmacologic and non-pharmacologic treatment to control their blood pressure. These are separate workflows.

If the set of blood pressure readings are above the patientâ€™s goal, the tool will recommend that the patient begin non-pharmacologic treatment. If blood pressure remains above goal after three months of non-pharmacologic treatment, the tool will then recommend beginning pharmacologic treatment.
If blood pressure is below goal, the tool will recommend ongoing monitoring but no further recommendations will be provided unless changes in blood pressure are detected.
